title: Fix StarCraft UI implementation - proper layout and streaming
description:
The current StarCraft UI has major issues:
1. Streaming content pushes CLI input down (breaking user experience)
2. Layout doesn't match the required 5-component design:
   - Top resource bar (tokens, model, temp, cycle, cost) 
   - Main middle pane that scrolls without displacing input
   - Bottom 3 panels: reasoning, tool, log
3. Visual hierarchy is wrong - no clear separation between main content and peripheral info

Need to implement proper fixed-layout that works with CLI input and streaming.

title: Smooth dashboard screen transition
description: Rich alt-screen is flickering between main and alt buffer on every query. Need to keep dashboard usable without jarring buffer swaps (likely by keeping Live persistent across requests or gating screen=True).

title: Redesign StarCraft UI with proper 5-component layout as specified
description:
Implement the correct StarCraft UI layout with:
1. Top resource bar (tokens, model, temp, cycle, cost) - mostly static
2. Main middle pane - query + streaming content that scrolls without pushing input
3. Bottom row with 3 panels: reasoning (cycle progress), tool (current operation), log (timestamped events)
4. Proper visual hierarchy with the specified design mockup

title: Integrate screen=True into StarCraftDashboard
description:
Use Rich Live with screen=True (alternate buffer mode).

Key findings:
- screen=True switches to alternate terminal buffer (like vim)
- Dashboard renders in alt buffer without fighting prompt_toolkit
- When Live exits, returns cleanly to main buffer
